mpi-buffer-deref.description:
Description

This check verifies if a buffer passed to an MPI (Message Passing Interface)
function is sufficiently dereferenced. Buffers should be passed as a single
pointer or array. As MPI function signatures specify
void
*
for their
buffer types, insufficiently dereferenced buffers can be passed, like for
example as double pointers or multidimensional arrays, without a compiler
warning emitted.

Examples:

// A double pointer is passed to the MPI function.
char
*
buf
;
MPI_Send
(
&
buf
,
1
,
MPI_CHAR
,
0
,
0
,
MPI_COMM_WORLD
);
// A multidimensional array is passed to the MPI function.
short
buf
[
1
][
1
];
MPI_Send
(
buf
,
1
,
MPI_SHORT
,
0
,
0
,
MPI_COMM_WORLD
);
// A pointer to an array is passed to the MPI function.
short
*
buf
[
1
];
MPI_Send
(
buf
,
1
,
MPI_SHORT
,
0
,
0
,
MPI_COMM_WORLD
);
mpi-buffer-deref.option:
Static analysis (Clang-Tidy) options are configured via .clang-tidy file.

This rule has no specific options.
